Withdrawal of plan to sharply increase "national defence spending" demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration in a statement issued on June 12 demanded the repeal of the plan for an increase in the "national defence spending", according to a news report.
 Recalling that some days ago the South Korean Ministry of Defence sharply increased the "national defence budget" for the next year with a view to introducing ultra modern military hardware, the statement dismissed this as a treacherous act of yielding to the pressure put by the U.S. upon South Korea to support its "plan for arms buildup". Noting with indignation that the issue of national defence is decided upon according to the will of outsiders, the statement denounced the ministry for supporting the U.S. in its arms buildup, even spending money collected from the people as taxes and strongly demanded the withdrawal of the plan.

Candlelight meeting held in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, June 17 (KCNA) -- A candlelight meeting was held at March 1 Park in Kwangjok-Myon of Yangju county, Kyonggi Province on June 12 to commemorate the 1st anniversary of the murder of schoolgirls, according to KBS of South Korea.
 It was attended by members of the All-People Measure Committee for Sin Hyo Sun and Sim Mi Son, Schoolgirls Killed By a U.S. Armored Car, parents of the schoolgirls and over 300 inhabitants there.    
 The participants demanded the revision of the unequal SOFA, the punishment of the GI murderers and so on.
